intro: Frangula alnus subsp. alnus, commonly known as common sallow, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by orange-yellow berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for birds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
